text: 355ml can. This one is a hopped up lager. Bitter and ultimately drinkable and decent.

Can. Pours a clear dark gold body with a one finger foamy beige head. The nose is mostly toasty malt with a slight hint of caramel sweetness. The flavor is toasted malt, a slightly higher than expected level of leafy hoppiness, and some lingering husky cereal grain. Light bodied with fizzy carbonation and a lingering husky finish. Not a bad effort, but not quite up to Anchor standards.

Great pour, amber body with strong long-lasting off-white head and heavy lacing (can; 12/14/16). Floral nose. Moderately sweet malty backbone with excellent hop balance. Fresh, orange citrus palate with a short, clean finish. All-day drinker.
Basic ale flavoring. A touch of malts for sugars, but a little hops for the balanced bitters. Nice orange color. Tap at brewery
The Majestic, Alexandria can: pours light amber with a white head. Aroma is light apple juice, hints of citrus, maltiness. Taste is lightly hoppy. Some fruitiness and stuff. Some aftertaste.
Easy drinking with a little basement musk like old boxes of records. Clear orange pour with ok head. Crisp finish. Tap at Glens.

Labeled as "Chesapeake Common" on the can. Deep golden color with a short white head. Light fruity nose. Grainy taste with some raw bread dough. Apple and bitter orange. Some wet toast in the finish. This drinks a bit harsh.
Tap at festival. Pours mostly clear amber. Aroma and flavor are lager yeast esters, floral hops, bready malt, and faint toffee. Light/medium body.

Draft at Magerks. Pours clear amber with a fizzy off white head. Tastes like corn, doughy malt, mild citrus hops, and booze. Light body and low carbonation. Smells like corn, booze, doughy malt, and faint citrus hops.

Sample at Industry Night at HomeBrewCon.
Lightly fruity faint pilsner malt spicy floral hops not bad.
Pours dark golden with a white head. Aroma is malt with earthy hops. Flavor is light fruity malt with bready notes and a herbal, earthy, woody pine finish.
Draft. Clear deep golden color, thick white head with good retention. Aroma of lightly peppery cereal. Taste has vanilla, some raw bread dough, light spice. Tasty.
